TopicTitle: Nuclear Nerv only uses Liquid Fuel now?

Articles.Content: Does this mean it is possible to make a Spaceplane using only liquid fuel? Rocket engines + Nerv + Liquid tanks only? No more oxidizer?
Wow, that's an interesting idea! Maybe you could - if you could cope with the extreme weight of the Nerv...

nukes have the worst ISP while in atmo so your high atmo to LKO transition would not work you still need regular rockets for the final push, once your in space though you should be good to go. you could make a plane with very little oxi and a couple LVN for that nudge then completely switch to nukes which are also very heavy so you would probably want to use these on a bigger SSTO
Yep. And rockets using it can dump the fuel oxidizer.

PSA: the atmo/vacuum ISP thing is not, RPT NOT a binary affair. Nukes work well in the upper atmosphere (or on Duna, for that matter). If you don't believe me, run a test: use the PresMat Barometer or launch a booster-assisted nerva and watch it's ISP as it goes up.

Their TWR may be problematic, but their ISP will be not.
By dump I meant you could get rid of it in VAB.

once you overcome the weight of the engine yeah...

OH! and the overheating issue as well...
I second Laie: As was true in 0.90, the LV-N has the highest ISP (barring jet engines) in the game at a mere 6km up.

Back in 0.90 I made spaceplanes (capable of getting to orbit and back, both on Kerbin and Laythe) using only turbojets and atomic engines--if you can get fast enough and high enough with the turbojets, atomic engines *can* be enough to complete the orbit, and then you are, as they say, halfway to anywhere.

The problem I'm having at the moment is that I can't get "fast enough and high enough," and I'm also concerned about overheating. Certainly something to try out more later; right now I have my hands full with orbital science stations and ore refineries!

As for liquid-fuel-only tanks: try using the Mk2 and Mk3 spaceplane parts instead of conventional rocket fuel tanks.
